To determine whether a subset is open or closed, we need to check if it belongs to the topology τ or if its complement belongs to the topology τ, respectively.

1. {a} is open since it belongs to the topology τ.

2. {a,b} is neither open nor closed. It is not open because it is not in τ. Its complement {c,d} is also not in τ, so it is not closed either.

3. {b,c,d} is closed. Its complement {a} is in the topology τ.

4. {c,d} is neither open nor closed. It is not open because it is not in τ. Its complement {a,b} is also not in τ, so it is not closed either.

5. {a,b,c,d} is open since it belongs to the topology τ (it is equal to X). Additionally, its complement, the empty set {}, is also in τ, so it is also closed. In a topology, the whole set X and the empty set are always both open and closed.
